instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
I have a 820-00165-A board, no power. Slight corrosion on C6100 which was cleaned up. No other signs of damage or corrosion.

ppbus_g3h is 8.59
pp_3v42 is 3.44
pp3v3_sus is 3.3

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message: Trigger SMC_ONOFF_L and check for drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L.

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message: There is a drop pulse at PM_PWRBTN_L when triggering SMC_ONOFF_L

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message: Then check for pulse at PM_SLP_S4/3_L, at same time.

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message: Neither S3 or S4 have voltage/pulse

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
Then must be PCH related problem.
Check SMC_ADAPTER_EN, PM_DSW_PWRGD, PCH_DSWVRMEN, PM_BATLOW_L and all PCH's RTC signals.

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
SMC_ADAPTER_EN is 3.4
PM_DSW_PWRGD is 3.44
PCH_DSWVRMEN is 3.2
PM_BATLOW_L is .245

PCH_CLK32K_RTCX is .411
PCH_INTRUDER_L is 3.06
PCH_INTVRMEN is 3.34
PCH_SRTCRST_L is 3.34
RTC_RESET_L is 3.34

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
"PM_BATLOW_L is .245"
PCH requires high level to start power on sequence.
Using 45W original Magsafe 2 charger?
Try 60/85W too.
Also try to start with both charger and battery connected.

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
I am using an original 85W charger.

W/ battery&charger connected PM_BATLOW_L is .156v
reading in diode is .49 (with no battery)

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
And board still doesn't even try to start?
Check R1410 if good.

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
not getting any fan spin.  r1410 is only reading 7.7k ohms.  i took the resistor off and it read 10ohm.  I replaced it for fun but went back down to 7.7ohms and still no fan spin.

should i change q3000 and smc to fix maybe?

threads.title: 820-00165-A No life
threads.message:
You can remove Q3000 and check PM_BATLOW_L.
I doubt to be fault.
You may need to change SMC; reball it first.
